definitions.definition: A crack, crevice, fissure, or hole which admits water or other fluid, or lets it escape.
The entrance or escape of a fluid through a crack, fissure, or other aperture.
definitions.example: The babies' diapers had big leaks.

definitions.definition: A divulgation, or disclosure, of information previously held secret.
definitions.example: The leaks by Chelsea Manning showed the secrets of the US military.

definitions.definition: The person through whom such divulgation, or disclosure, occurs.
definitions.example: The press must have learned about the plan through a leak.

definitions.definition: A loss of electricity through imperfect insulation, or the point where it occurs.
The gradual loss of a system resource caused by failure to deallocate previously reserved portions.
(especially with the verb "take") An act of urination.
definitions.example: I have to take a leak.

definitions.definition: To allow fluid or gas to pass through an opening that should be sealed.
definitions.example: The faucet has been leaking since last month.

definitions.definition: (of a fluid or gas) To pass through an opening that should be sealed.
definitions.example: No one realized that propane gas was leaking from a rusty tank in the concession area, slowly filling the unventilated room.

definitions.definition: To disclose secret information surreptitiously or anonymously.
definitions.example: Someone must have leaked it to our competitors that the new product will be out soon.
